quantum.title: The Rise of Quantum Computing
quantum.excerpt: Exploring the potential of quantum computers in solving complex problems.
quantum.introduction: Quantum computing technology harnesses quantum mechanical phenomena to perform complex calculations. This technology offers immense potential for solving problems that are intractable for classical computers.

2020.title: IBM Quantum Volume 64
2020.description: Major milestone in quantum computer development

2021.title: Quantum Error Correction Breakthrough
2021.description: First validation of QEC on logical qubits

market.title: Market Analysis
market.description: The global quantum computing market shows aggressive growth prospects. MarketsandMarkets projects the market will reach USD 20.20 Billion by 2030.

sections.title: What is a Qubit?
sections.content: A qubit is the basic unit of quantum information, analogous to a bit in classical computers. However, unlike classical bits that can only be 0 or 1, qubits can exist in a superposition of both states simultaneously.

sections.title: Quantum Superposition
sections.content: Superposition is a quantum phenomenon where a system can exist in multiple states at once. This enables quantum computers to process vast numbers of possibilities in parallel.

sections.title: Quantum Entanglement
sections.content: Entanglement is a quantum phenomenon where two or more qubits become connected in such a way that the quantum state of each cannot be described independently, regardless of physical distance.
